verses.verse: After <WH310> these things <WH1697> King <WH4428> Ahasuerus <WH325> promoted <WH1431> Haman <WH2001> the son <WH1121> of Hammedatha <WH4099> the Agagite, <WH91> and advanced <WH5375> him, <WH7760> and set his seat <WH3678> above all the princes who were with him. <WH8269>

Haman <WH2001> said <WH559> to King <WH4428> Ahasuerus, <WH325> "There is <WH3426> a certain <WH259> people <WH5971> scattered abroad <WH6340> and dispersed <WH6504> among the peoples <WH5971> in all the provinces <WH4082> of your kingdom, <WH4438> and their laws <WH1881> are different <WH8138> than other people <WH5971>'s. If it pleases <WH2895> the king, <WH4428> let it be written <WH3789> that they be destroyed; <WH6> and I will pay <WH8254> ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> talents <WH3603> of silver <WH3701> into the hands <WH3027> of those who are in charge <WH6213> of the king <WH4399>'s business, to bring <WH935> it into the king <WH4428>'s treasuries. <WH1595>"

The king <WH4428> said <WH559> to Haman, <WH2001> "The silver <WH3701> is given <WH5414> to you, <WH5971> the people also, <WH6213> to do with them as it seems <WH5869> good to you. <WH2896>"
